title: Week 7 Division II Football Preview
text: Last updated on October 14, 2015 @ 1:24PM Created on October 14, 2015 @ 12:30PM Courtesy: Mountain East Conference Week seven in the Mountain East Conference begins on Thursday night as Glenville State steps out of conference to take on Alderson Broaddus. Complete conference action continues on Saturday at noon with West Virginia State (4-2) at No. 9 Shepherd (5-0) and Concord (4-2) traveling to Notre Dame (1-5). Two of the hottest teams in the league meet as Charleston (5-1) puts its four-game winning streak on the line against a Fairmont State (3-2) team that has won three-straight. West Liberty (3-3) will try to bounce back from a narrow loss against UVa-Wise (0-6), while Urbana (2-4) travels to a Buckhannon to take on a winless West Virginia Wesleyan (0-6) squad. Week Six Rewind Fairmont State extended its winning streak to three games by holding off West Virginia Wesleyan, 31-27 ... Cooper Hibbs was 20-of-31 for 376 with three touchdowns and no interceptions ... Fabian Guerra had his highest output of the season with nine catches for 168 yards ... WVWC's Ryan Deal threw four touchdowns for the second-straight week and his 473 yards passing were the second-most in MEC history ... Shepherd earned a key road win over Glenville State, 48-31 ... Jabre Lolley had 230 all-purpose yards and scored three touchdowns (two receiving, one rushing) ... Jeff Ziemba was 17-of-28 for 292 with three touchdowns ... the Pioneers had five sacks in the game ... Tevin Drake had 112 rushing yards and a TD ... UC overcame a halftime deficit to pick up a 42-37 win on the road against West Liberty ... an on-side kick in the third quarter helped change the momentum and gave the Golden Eagles an extra possession to score and take a lead it would not relinquish ... WLU out-gained UC in the game (515-449) ... Jeremy Johnson had 217 yards passing and one touchdown and 107 yards rushing and one score ... Dakota Conwell threw four TD passes and had 399 yards through the air ... West Virginia State scored with less than a minute to pick up a 32-29 win over Notre Dame ... it was WVSU's first home win of the season ... WVSU out-scored NDC 15-7 in the final quarter ... Malik Grove had a career-high 335 yards passing with three touchdowns ... Matt Kinnick was 33-of-55 for 370 yards with two scores and no interceptions ... Tyrone Barber had his second 100-yard rushing game of the season for the Yellow Jackets ... Calvinaugh Jones rushed for a career-high 260 yards and three touchodwns as Concord rolled to a 63-21 win over UVa-Wise ... the Mountain Lions led 27-0 after the first quarter ... CU held the Cavs to -9 yards rushing ... Zachary Blair had 12 tackles and matched the single-game MEC record for tackles for a loss with five for UVa-Wise ... Urbana picked up the MEC's first non-conference win of the season with a 33-30 win over Lake Erie ... Deonta Rudasill had 110 yards rushing for the Blue Knights and Eric Pelfrey got the start at quarterback and was 14-of-21 for 170 yards with two scores and no interceptions ... D'Gary Wallace racked up 19 tackles (11 solo) and recovered a key fumble at the end of the first half. Home teams went 3-2 ast week in the MEC. Home teams are 6-0 in the MEC Thursday Night Game of the Week. Four players have thrown four TD passes in a game this season ... two of them are from West Virginia Wesleyan (Luke Casey and Ryan Deal) ... Deal and Dakota Conwell have accomplished the feat twice. Dakota Conwell's five touchdowns responsible for last week is the most in the MEC this season. Tevin Drake's 26 rushing attempts last week against Shepherd were second-most in the league this season. WVSU has three of the MEC's seven games of 50+ points or more this season. Glenville State's 64 points (vs. West Virginia Wesleyan) are the most in a game this season. There have been four shutouts in the MEC this season, most recently Fairmont State blanking Urbana two weeks ago. There were just two shutouts in the MEC in 2014 and five in 2013. Four players from the MEC are in the top 25 in points per game, led by Calvinaugh Jones (CU) and Tyrone Barber (WVSU) at 11.0 (11th in the country), followed by Shepherd's Ryan Earls at 10.8 (16th) and Jabre Lolley at 10.5 (19th) Only 5 teams in the NCAA Division II have yet to throw an interception this season, and two of them reside in the MEC: Fairmont State and Shepherd. WVWC's Ryan Deal has the three longest passes in the MEC this season to his credit (89 yards vs. Concord, 85 against West Liberty and 85 vs. Fairmont State). Share
